Sentence.sentence: They found that the principal requirement for what is called “global cascades” -the widespread propagation of influence through networks -is the presence not of a few influentials but, rather, of a critical mass of easily influenced people.

If people in the network just two degrees removed from the initial influential prove resistant,for example from the initial influential prove resistant,for example the cascade of change won’t propagate very far or affect many people.
Members of social networks, for instance, are learning that they can hijack media to apply pressure on the businesses that originally created them.

This is because the networked computer has sparked a secret war between downloading and uploading - between passive consumption and active creation - whose outcome will shape our collective future in ways we can only begin to imagine.
The networked computer offers the first chance in 50 years to reverse the flow, to encourage thoughtful downloading and, even more importantly, meaningful uploading.
The networked computer is an amazing device, the first media machine that serves as the mode of production, means of distribution, site of reception, and place of praise and critique.
Second, the majority of people who use networked computers to upload are not even aware of the significance of what they are doing.
An emerging body of research shows that positive health habits-as well as negative ones-spread through networks of friends via social communication.

sentences.cn: 现在许多地方台的节目已在全国联播。

sentences.en: I've networked your résumé.
sentences.cn: 我已把你的简历分发出去了。</seg>

entry.def: A network of lines, roads, veins, or other long thin things is a large number of them which cross each other or meet at many points.

example.ex: ...Strasbourg, with its rambling network of medieval streets...
example.tran: 中世纪街道纵横交织的斯特拉斯堡

example.ex: The uterus is supplied with a rich network of blood vessels and nerves.
example.tran: 密布的血管和神经网向子宫输送养料。

entry.def: A network of people or institutions is a large number of them that have a connection with each other and work together as a system.

example.ex: Distribution of the food is going ahead using a network of local church people and other volunteers...
example.tran: 食品正通过当地教会人士和其他志愿者形成的网络分发下去。

example.ex: He is keen to point out the benefits which the family network can provide.
example.tran: 他很乐意指出家庭网络可以带来的好处。

entry.def: A particular network is a system of things which are connected and which operate together. For example, a computer network consists of a number of computers that are part of the same system.

example.tran: 有154个终端的计算机网络

example.ex: Huge sections of the rail network are out of action.
example.tran: 铁路网的很多区段停运。

entry.def: A radio or television network is a company or group of companies that broadcasts radio or television programmes throughout an area.

example.ex: An American network says it has obtained the recordings.
example.tran: 美国一家广播网声称已经得到了那些录音材料。

example.ex: ...Fuji Television Network, a highly successful commercial station.
example.tran: 富士电视网,一家非常成功的商业电视台

entry.def: When a television or radio programme is networked, it is broadcast at the same time by several different television companies.
entry.tran: 对(电视或广播节目)进行联播

example.ex: Lumsdon would like to see his programme sold and networked...
example.tran: 拉姆斯敦希望看到自己的节目卖出，并进行联播。

example.ex: He had once had his own networked chat show.
example.tran: 他曾经拥有自己的电视联播访谈节目。

entry.def: If you network, you try to meet new people who might be useful to you in your job.

example.ex: In business, it is important to network with as many people as possible on a face to face basis.
example.tran: 在生意场上，通过与尽可能多的人面对面地打交道来建立工作关系很重要。

means.word_mean: 1. an interconnected system of things or people;

sentences.sentence: "retirement meant dropping out of a whole network of people who had been part of my life"

means.word_mean: 2. (broadcasting) a communication system consisting of a group of broadcasting stations that all transmit the same programs;

sentences.sentence: "the networks compete to broadcast important sports events"

means.word_mean: 3. an open fabric of string or rope or wire woven together at regular intervals
4. a system of intersecting lines or channels;
5. (electronics) a system of interconnected electronic components or circuits
1. communicate with and within a group;

sentences.sentence: "You have to network if you want to get a good job"
